H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H5055.def: = action by which an animal pierces or stabs humans or other animals with its horns

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H947.def: = action by which humans move their arms and legs in an uncontrolled, haphazard fashion, like a young baby

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation
= action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2186.def: = process by which an object acquires characteristics that are considered unacceptable

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H4242.def: = the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3933.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H7047.def: = action by which someone speaks insulting words to someone else, ◄ out of a sense of superiority, ► intending to bring public shame upon that person

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H4493.def: literally: shaking of the head; hence: = action by which humans turn their head from one side to the other  ► to express scorn and derision

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H523.def: = a large body of people united by common descent

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H1442.def: = action by which a human being utters words that are intended to provoke shame in someone else

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H5358.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H8266.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H838.def: literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H1794.def: literally: to crush; hence: = causative by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a individual or group ◄ as if crushing that person or those people with a heavy object

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

14.gl: to spread out one's hands > to pray

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H2878.def: = act of killing an animal by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe + with a sharp-bladed instrument

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3462.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H2186.def: = process by which an object acquires characteristics that are considered unacceptable

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H3906.def: = causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
